reviewText: This is a documentary. Some of his songs are included, but not in their entirety. Still, it's a pretty good documentary, especially if you know anything about Roger's Music.
On-time, as described, couldn't ask for more.
Great biography on one of my favorite composers and singer/writers

I first saw this video presented at the Roger Miller Museum in Erick Oklahoma. It is so good it is presented at the museum and it is quite entertaining and informative. I don't think I have seen a more thorough presentation on his life and it is presented with fairness that is just not seen that much any more. While a little short in length, it is very well done and very much worth the purchase price. It cost much less here than it does at the museum so that also says something. I am glad I waited until I got to Amazon to check the price, it saved me about $15. The Keystone Kid
Fast service on quality dvd of my favorite country western singer, songwriter. Been that way since "King of the Road" and stays that way. Enjoyable, well done dvd.

This documentary is great and offers insight into his music and Roger Miller the person.  Keeps your interest, moves quickly, but over way to soon. If you have an interest in Roger Miller's music, this DVD is highly recommended.

Roger was a musical genius.  The things he could do with his voice

is one thing, his real magic lay in his writing.  Thinking about the music that is being cranked out today, I don't think anyone today can match wits with Rogers writing ability.
